title: Finding out the pattern with Pascal's Triangle.
text: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is $$8$$.
speech: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is  8 .
pacedSpeech: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is   8

title: Finding out the coefficients.
text: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are $$1$$, $$8$$, $$28$$, $$56$$, $$70$$, $$56$$, $$28$$, $$8$$, $$1$$.
speech: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are  1 ,  8 ,  28 ,  56 ,  70 ,  56 ,  28 ,  8 ,  1 .
pacedSpeech: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are   1

title: Expanding the polynomial.
text: Use the formula: $${\left(a+b\right)}^n$$ $$=$$ $$a^n$$ + $$___$$ $$a^n-1b^1$$ + $$___$$ $$a^n-2b^2$$ +... + $$___$$ $$a^1 b^n-1$$ + $$b^n$$ and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.
speech: Use the formula:  parentheses a plus b,  to the n-th   is equal to   a to the n-th  +  blank   a to the n-th minus 1 b to the first,  +  blank   a to the n-th minus 2 b squared,  +... +  blank  , a to the first b to the n-th minus, 1  +  b to the n-th  and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.
pacedSpeech: Use the formula:    a plus b,  to the n-th
a to the n-th minus 1 b to the first,
a to the n-th minus 2 b squared,
, a to the first b to the n-th minus, 1
and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.

title: Plugging in the coefficients.
text: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get $$a^8+8a^7 b^1+28a^6 b^2+56a^5 b^3+70a^4 b^4+56a^3 b^5+28a^2 b^6+8a^1 b^7+b^8$$.
speech: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get  a to the eighth plus, 8 a to the seventh b to the first plus, 28 a to the sixth b squared plus, 56 a to the fifth b cubed plus, 70 a to the fourth b to the fourth plus, 56 a cubed b to the fifth plus, 28 a squared b to the sixth plus, 8 a to the first b to the seventh plus b to the eighth .
pacedSpeech: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get  this expression
